==0â9==
  +
[[Image:Homeofthe12thMan.jpg|thumb|right|Texas A&M's football stadium, Kyle Field, student section with the sign "Home of the 12th Man"]]
  +
;[[12th Man (football)|12th Man]]: The student section in athletics events.<ref name="sandiego">{{cite news | last = Greenwald | first = Michael | title = Crash course in Rooting for Aggies | publisher = [[San Diego Union-Tribune]] | date = 14 December 2006 | url = http://www.signonsandiego.com/uniontrib/20061224/news_1s24am.html| accessdate = 25 December 2008}}</ref><ref name="beano">{{cite web| last=Cook |first=Beano |title=Ten Days That Shook the Sport |publisher=ESPN |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/ncf/news/story?id=2615391 |date= 8 October 2006 |accessdate= 2 February 2008}}</ref><ref name="frozenlake">{{cite paper | author =Stanford, Frank S. | title =Escaping the Frozen Lake: Individual and Social Idealism Manifest As Forms of Religion and Religiosity: A Dissertation | publisher =Office of Graduate Studies of Texas A&M University | date =December 2003 | url =https://txspace.tamu.edu/bitstream/handle/1969.1/198/etd-tamu-2003C-SOCI-Stanford-1.pdf?sequence=1 | format =PDF | accessdate=13 September 2007|pages=109â110}}</ref><ref name="2002Traditions">{{cite news|url=http://media.www.thebatt.com/media/storage/paper657/news/2002/09/02/Campus/Traditions.A.Major.Part.Of.Am.Life-518399.shtml |title=Traditions a major part of A&M life |accessdate=7 December 2008 |date= 9 February 2008 |newspaper=The Battalion}}</ref><ref name="SouthernCulture">{{cite paper | first = Meredith | last = Paddon | title = Southern Reveille: Southern Culture and Tradition at Texas A&M University | publisher = Texas A&M University | date = April 2007 | url = http://txspace.tamu.edu/bitstream/handle/1969.1/5726/thesisfinal.pdf?sequence=1 | format = PDF | accessdate = 09 January 2009}}</ref>
  +   +
;2 Percenters: Aggies who choose not to participate in [[Traditions of Texas A&M University|Texas A&M traditions]].<ref name="frozenlake"/><ref name="Chron5700">{{cite news| url=http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/page1/545502.html| title=A&M ponders scathing words in wake of Bonfire tragedy| newspaper=Houston Chronicle| accessdate=1 January 2009| date=7 May 2000| author=Nissimov, Ron}}</ref><ref name= "agathletics">{{cite web|title=Aggie Terminology|publisher=Texas A&M Athletics|year=2007|url=http://sports.tamu.edu/statsYBY.php?&CAT=TRD&pageID=221|accessdate=24 September 2007}}</ref><ref name="scharf">{{cite news|last=Scharf|first=Steve|title=Big 12 schools are rich in tradition|date=18 July 2008|publisher=The Daily Nebraskan| publisher=[[University of Nebraska]]| url=http://media.www.dailynebraskan.com/media/storage/paper857/news/2007/02/12/LifeStyle/Big-12.Schools.Are.Rich.In.Tradition-2711478.shtml | accessdate=25 December 2008}}</ref>
==A==
==A==
Line 17: Line 17:
;[[Aggieland]]: Name for Texas A&M and the surrounding metropolitan area, [[BryanâCollege Station metropolitan area|BryanâCollege Station]], [[Texas]].<ref name= "frozenlake"/><ref name="Chron5700"/><ref name= "agathletics"/><ref name="corpsdict"/> The phrase, "Welcome to Aggieland", was at the center of one of the university's marketing campaigns.<ref name= "Welcome">{{cite web | title = Welcome to Aggieland | publisher = Texas A&M University | url = http://www.tamu.edu/visit/ | accessdate = 27 January 2007}}</ref>
;[[Aggieland]]: Name for Texas A&M and the surrounding metropolitan area, [[BryanâCollege Station metropolitan area|BryanâCollege Station]], [[Texas]].<ref name= "frozenlake"/><ref name="Chron5700"/><ref name= "agathletics"/><ref name="corpsdict"/> The phrase, "Welcome to Aggieland", was at the center of one of the university's marketing campaigns.<ref name= "Welcome">{{cite web | title = Welcome to Aggieland | publisher = Texas A&M University | url = http://www.tamu.edu/visit/ | accessdate = 27 January 2007}}</ref>
  +   +
==B==
  +
[[Image:Aggiebonfire2005.jpg|right|upright|thumb|Student Bonfire, 2005]]
  +
;Bad Bull: Anything not in keeping with Aggie traditions or the Aggie spirit.<ref name="frozenlake"/><ref name="corpsdict">{{cite web |url=http://b-batt.aggieband.org/dictionary.html |title=Corps Dictionary |accessdate=13 May 2007 |publisher=Texas A&M University}}</ref>
  +   +
;Batt: Short for the [[Student newspaper|school newspaper]], ''[[The Battalion]]''.<ref name="corpsdict"/>
  +   +
;[[Aggie Bonfire]] (or Bonfire): A large [[bonfire]] built before the annual [[college football]] game against the [[University of Texas at Austin]].<ref name="SouthernCulture"/> Bonfire symbolizes a "burning desire to beat the hell outta t.u."<ref name="frozenlake"/><ref name="War Hymn">{{cite news | url=http://www.aggieband.com/story/warhymn.html | title=War Hymn | author=Harris, Patrick | accessdate=18 September 2007}}</ref> Aggie Bonfire at one time held the world record for the height of a bonfire at 109 ft, 10 in (33 m) tall.<ref name="WorldRec">{{cite web|last=Morris|first=Dave|date=8 December 1999| url=http://www.salon.com/books/it/1999/12/08/bonfire/index.html| title=Memories of an Aggie bonfire boy |publisher=[[Salon.com]]| accessdate=14 August 2007}}</ref> Due to the November 18, 1999 collapse of Bonfire that killed 12 and injured 27,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/US/9911/18/students.crushed.02/|title=Texas A&M students killed, trapped in collapse of bonfire logs|publisher=CNN|accessdate=19 December 2008|date=18 November 1999}}</ref> recent non-university sanctioned Bonfires, called Student Bonfire, are now performed off-campus.<ref name="windle">{{cite news| last=Watkins|first=Matthew| title = Off-campus bonfire|newspaper=The Battalion | url =http://209.189.226.235/stories/110106/am_20061101007.php|date=17 November 2005| accessdate = 21 February 2008}}</ref><ref name="hensley">{{cite news|last=Hensley |first=Laura | title = A year after fiasco, student bonfire set to burn | publisher=The BryanâCollege Station Eagle | url =http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-153713246.html |date=1 November 2006 | accessdate = 3 March 2007 }}</ref>
  +   +
;BQ: Member of the [[Fightin' Texas Aggie Band]], colloquially Band Queer, [[etymology|etymologically]] Band Qualified.<ref name="gravois"/>
==C==
